title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Le K (2025). housepack: Explore Australian Housing, Income, Capital Gains Trends. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {housepack: Explore Australian Housing, Income, and Capital Gains Trends},   author = {Kim Yen Le},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: HousePack
text: goal housepack help users explore connection Australian housing prices, disposable income per capita, capital gains 1985 2024. package provides cleaned datasets simple tools visualise trends describe housing market evolved across time regions.

title: HousePack
text: can install development version housepack GitHub: installation, load package:

title: HousePack
text: package includes three processed datasets: income_pc: yearly quarterly estimates disposable income per capita Australia. detached_full: detached house price index eight states territories 1985 2024. cgt_full: simulated average capital gains taxable individuals based ATO statistics. datasets support static functions interactive Shiny app.

title: HousePack
text: package provides helper functions make visualisation comparison easier. to_index() Converts numeric time series index chosen base year. function useful comparing growth across different variables use different scales. compare_trends() Creates plot compares indexed income per capita detached house prices time. helps reveal income housing costs diverged since 1990s.
code: indexed_income <- to_index(income_pc$Income_per_capita,                            year = income_pc$Year,                            base_year = 1990) compare_trends(income_pc, detached_full, base_year = 1990)

title: HousePack
text: installation, load package open interactive dashboard: app shows national state housing trends. Users can compare income growth house prices view differences across states interactive map.
code: library(housepack)  # Launch the Shiny app run_housepack()

title: Average Capital Gains (1985–2023) — cgt_full
text: Estimated average annual capital gains taxable individuals Australia. Values expressed thousands AUD include simulated early years.

title: Average Capital Gains (1985–2023) — cgt_full
Average Capital Gains (1985–2023) — cgt_full
text: data frame 3 variables: Year Financial year ending (numeric) FinYear Label "YYYY–YYYY" format Total_gain_adj Average capital gains (AUD '000)

title: Average Capital Gains (1985–2023) — cgt_full
text: Simulated compiled ABS ATO public datasets.

what: Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
title: Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
text: Creates ggplot showing two quarterly series (income housing) normalized base 100 using chosen base year (default = 1990). Uses quarterly data smoother visualization.

title: Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
text: income Data frame containing Date, Year, Quarter, Income_per_capita. housing Data frame containing Date, Year, Quarter, Australia (detached house index). base_year Year use normalization base (default = 1990).

title: Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
text: ggplot object showing normalized quarterly trends series.

title: Compare two time series on a base-100 index scale (quarterly) — compare_trends
code: compare_trends(income_pc, detached_full, base_year = 1990) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`).

what: Detached House Price Index by State (Australia) — detached_full
title: Detached House Price Index by State (Australia) — detached_full
text: Quarterly detached house price indices eight Australian states Australia-wide aggregate. Data includes simulated pre-2002 values.

title: Detached House Price Index by State (Australia) — detached_full
Detached House Price Index by State (Australia) — detached_full
text: data frame 12 variables: Date Quarterly date YYYY-MM-DD format Year Calendar year Quarter Quarter number (1–4) Dwelling_index Residential property price index (ABS) Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Perth, Hobart, Darwin, Canberra State-level detached house indices Australia Weighted average 8 capitals

title: Detached House Price Index by State (Australia) — detached_full
text: Simulated compiled ABS ATO public datasets.

what: Quarterly Household Disposable Income per Capita (Australia) — income_pc
title: Quarterly Household Disposable Income per Capita (Australia) — income_pc
text: quarterly time series real household disposable income per capita. Data covers 1985–2024 adjusted real AUD.

title: Quarterly Household Disposable Income per Capita (Australia) — income_pc
Quarterly Household Disposable Income per Capita (Australia) — income_pc
text: data frame 4 variables: Date Quarterly date YYYY-MM-DD format Year Calendar year Quarter Quarter number (1–4) Income_per_capita Real household disposable income per capita (AUD)

title: Quarterly Household Disposable Income per Capita (Australia) — income_pc
text: Simulated compiled ABS ATO public datasets.

what: Convert a numeric series to an index with a chosen base year — to_index
title: Convert a numeric series to an index with a chosen base year — to_index
text: Scales numeric vector value specified base year (first non-missing observation default) equals 100.

title: Convert a numeric series to an index with a chosen base year — to_index
Convert a numeric series to an index with a chosen base year — to_index
text: x Numeric vector. year Optional numeric vector length x, giving year observation. base_year Year use 100-point base. NULL, first non-missing value used.

title: Convert a numeric series to an index with a chosen base year — to_index
text: Numeric vector rescaled base 100.
